intro: Octomeria lamellaris, commonly known as the flat-leaf octomeria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, flat leaves that are often covered in a waxy layer, aiding in water retention. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
